page.title: 27Kitchen appliances in Timsbury
page.content:
Out of the thirty four Timsbury surveys we sent out all thirty four people had an oven and only for people had a hob. Twenty four people had a dishwasher. This is a marvellous invention because it means people don't have to wash their dirty dishes by hand. They simply put the grubby items in dishwasher, add a washing tablet, close the door and switch it on. This leaves owners free to enjoy their spare time. I am surprised that not every house has one!

Having a microwave is great but only twenty six people had one. Instead of taking ages making food and putting it in the oven, get a readymade meal from the freezer and pop it in the microwave for a few minutes. I think everyone should get one because they are very useful.

Only one person has a sandwich toaster. I know it's pretty weird to toast sandwiches but it saves time! And one late counted survey even has a candyfloss maker! Fourteen people had a handy toaster for toasting bread. Yummy! We counted that four people a mixer or a blender. Kettles are for making cuppas which sixteen people owned. This object is very handy at stressed and hectic times. Just plug it in, boil the water, add a tea bag pour the water and voila! You've got yourself a cuppa! Large machines were highly popular as thirty two people had a fridge-freezer. Everybody had a washing machine. Two people had slow cookers, five people had a health grill and four people had fryers. Six people had a tumble dryer and only one person had scales.
Hattie and Elsa
